language.entry: Black Reliquary will be a drastically different experience from what you are used to. Abandon what you think you know. The majority of mechanics have been overhauled or re-tuned, as well as dramatic alterations to some heroes. What has most certainly remained the same is that when your heroes die, they stay dead.

The challenges you face now will ask a lot of you. Your skill, adaptation, and powers of observation will be put to the test. You will know little mercy, but will taste well-earned triumphs in these new lands.
All-too-familiar faces will mingle with new acquaintances in your new home as you launch your campaign of valor, fortune, and redemption against the emerging darkness of the...

Be sure to check out our Discord and Twitter for more mod updates!
Unfortunately, we can't get rid of this pop-up, or even make it link to our socials properly.
This pop-up was meant to ask about data collection required for The Butcher’s Circus DLC. We can't get rid of this pop-up, but Butcher's Circus is not accessible in Black Reliquary.
Reliquary campaigns are the "original" settings for the game. For those familiar with Darkest Dungeon, this will test your skills.
Drag Addons to Prioritize. Top of list has highest priority.
Your version of Black Reliquary is now up to date
Drag QUEST ITEM from inventory here.

The Kvarotz upper ruins are sunken into the sands. Determine what can be navigated.
Scour the ruins in the sands for anything which can be of use to us.
The Wildlanders residing in the ravaged remains of the Kvarotz buildings may yet have things we can find useful.
The Kvarotz upper ruins are sunken into the sands. Determine what can be navigated.
Scour the ruins in the sands for anything which can be of use to us.
The Wildlanders residing in the ravaged remains of the Kvarotz buildings may yet have things we can find useful.
Kvarotz technology and Levantine supplies are abundant here. Bring back what you can.
Vital resources are bountiful deep within the dust-coated Kvarotz remains.
We need charts of the Catacombs to better scavenge supplies from it.
There is no place more ripe with Amber than these infested tunnels.
Navigate the labyrinth of tunnels for supplies, and exterminate some pests while you're at it.
Scour these caverns for materials and chart your route for future excursions.
Vast wealth awaits us in the Treasury, but it is not free for the taking.
Every chart of the Treasury makes looting its riches a little bit easier.
Reveal the traps and caches, and we will harvest the fruits of your efforts.
The Wildlanders do not belong in the valley. We must make a demonstration of them and rebuke their clans from these lands.
If the Wildlanders seek might and power, we will show it to them.
The exposed Kvarotz ruins are too inhabited for us to plunder. It is time to rectify this problem.
The Wildlanders do not belong in the valley. We must make a demonstration of them and rebuke their clans from these lands.
If the Wildlanders seek might and power, we will show it to them.
The exposed Kvarotz ruins are too inhabited for us to plunder. It is time to rectify this problem.
The Levantine encampments will only spread if we do not stem the tide.
Intercept the Levantine scouts before they can return to their commanders. We must slow their progress.
Establish control over more segments of the Catacombs. Every inch we claim pushes back the Levantine.
The Troglodytes should not be left to their own devices. Disrupt their sinister machinations.
The Troglodytes spawn in overwhelming numbers. We must once again prune their horde.
A terrible evil is forming deep within the cavernous maze. We shall hinder it in the most direct way possible.
It is time to reap the rewards of our scouting efforts.
We return to the halls of wealth, now to collect what we have earned.
Small hoards of riches have been located and charted. We need only to seize them.

The Wildlander Flayer prowls here this week. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}(50ʪ Chance to Encounter in Champ){colour_end}
Something calls out in the dunes...
We venture into the valley for the first time. The catacombs of the Kvarotz are a dangerous place in their own right, but the Levantine have made it their new dig site.
{?hero_names}%s retreated from our very first endeavor. This does not bode well.
{?hero_names}%s have become familiar with the valley. This is only the beginning.
{?hero_names}%s were the first to Enter the Catacombs
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The ancient Kvarotz mechanisms still skulk in the shadows.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Levantine have come to pilfer the vast necropolis of the Kvarotz.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Levantine soldiers are organized and disciplined, taking advantage of tactical opportunities.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Treasure is not found in darkness, but rather because of it.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Rusted Kvarotz electrum can be revitalized when oiled.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The sinister technology and knowledge of the Kvarotz contain dangerous powers.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Levantine take advantage of the chance to brace for combat, as should you.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Vendors ask for specific relics or special items to exchange
One of the Vizier's most talented Janissaries stands tall and proud in his camp, boldly displaying his location to us and boasting that he will give us an honorable defeat.
{?hero_names}%s could not stand to the Janissary's might. His challenge remains as an open invitation.
{?hero_names}%s have honorably defeated the Janissary, and claimed his relic.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Janissary insists upon one-on-one duels.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Janissary may call upon his forces to battle the heroes he's not dueling.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Agile and versatile, the Janissary does not make himself an easy target.

A leader of the Levantine has revealed her location to us and desires to defeat us herself. This open challenge will embolden her forces the longer it remains unanswered; extinguishing her now would prove most advantageous.
{?hero_names}%s were unable to defeat the Enchantress leader this day. We must be ready to strike again.
{?hero_names}%s have slain the Levantine Enchantress, and furthered our campaign.
{?hero_names}%s went to fight the Levantine Enchantress.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Enchantress prefers to strike from a distance.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Your heroes most vulnerable to toxins will be in great peril.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} A great many serpents will arise to defend the Enchantress.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Massive serpents can strike from unseen places.
One of the Matrons has made her camp known to us, directly challenging our mettle. Failure here would invariably rally her forces. Put an end to her iron-fisted reign.
{?hero_names}%s failed to stand up to the Warhawk Matron. Her clan's laughs echo through the dunes.
{?hero_names}%s preyed upon the Warhawk. Her followers are left rattled, and our control expands.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Warhawk's various munitions carry unique properties.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Warhawk may call upon her followers to liven up the fight.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Warhawk's attacks are diverse and can cover your team rather well.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Warhawk needs time to load her munitions.
Another matron cries out for battle, signaling herself to us from the sunken ruins below. Quell this warrior and we will diminish their morale in turn.
{?hero_names}%s were too weak for the Steelpath Matron. The bloodlust of her clan grows ever more fervent.
{?hero_names}%s vanquished the Steelpath Matron. The Wildlanders' grip continues to weaken.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Steelpath Matron thrives against bleeding opponents.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Steelpath's pack of hyenas are equally as bloodthirsty as the Matron.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Expect your heroes to bleed heavily.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Steelpath Matron's crazed bloodlust is not sustainable and can exhaust her.
The Troglodytes have grown a monstrosity. With each passing day, it feasts and grows. Destroy the damned thing before it gets any larger.
{?hero_names}%s could not quell the Gastrosaur's rampage.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Gastrosaur becomes more violent as its health diminishes.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The hide of the Gastrosaur is resilient. Honing Oil may be of use.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Supplies to cure and resist bleed and blight may be vital.
Our path deeper into Troglodyte territory is impeded by an unfathomable threat. It will take unconventional methods to achieve victory...
{?hero_names}%s could not face the Greater Wurm.
{?hero_names}%s set out to face the Greater Wurm.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Flameseeker will provide cannon fire when the moment is right.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Wurm's hide is far too durable to attack directly.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Every beast no matter how large has a weak spot. It may just need to be {colour_start|mark}revealed.{colour_end}
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Your heroes will not be able to deal fatal damage to the Wurm by themselves.
A critical path is guarded by a Cactonid mass of an unnervingly pleasant appeal...
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Alraune's suitors will only hold back once a hero is within their grasp.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Managing whoever is most suited to fight at the moment is key.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Flexible, balanced teams will be able to recover from the suitors' grasp.
Another node of the Cactonids is ripe to be plucked. Destroying this cluster of vines and roots is essential for us to reach the Reliquary.
{?hero_names}%s could not go through The Wall.
{?hero_names}%s toppled the wall and broke the Nucleic Growth.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Core's wall will take whatever shape it needs to protect itself.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The wall will not survive without the Core.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The living wall takes different forms which behave in different ways.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} A flexible team is ideal for the shape-shifting defenses of the Core.
We have found the Ghoul Mother at last. She has been looting our fallen heroes' possessions, hoarding them away in her filthy den. Let us reclaim what we have lost to this thief.
{?hero_names}%s were unsuccessful in their raid on the Ghoul Mother's den.
{?hero_names}%s returned with our possessions after dispatching the Ghoul Mother.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Ghoul Mother will not hesitate to feast on her kin if it ensures her survival.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Be prepared to deal with the Ghoul Mother's deafening assaults on the mind and sanity.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} If we tarry, the Ghoul Mother will flee with part of her hoard.
An excellent opportunity presents itself. Our scouts have located a hoard filled with our lost riches, scavenged by a singularly powerful Ghoul Mother. Rid us of this menace and reclaim what is ours.
{?hero_names}%s were unsuccessful in their raid on the Ghoul Mother's den.
{?hero_names}%s returned with our possessions after dispatching the Ghoul Mother.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Ghoul Mother will not hesitate to feast on her kin if it ensures her survival.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Be prepared to deal with the Ghoul Mother's deafening assaults on the mind and sanity.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} If we tarry, the Ghoul Mother will flee with part of her hoard.
The Ghoul Mother has scavenged %d lost trinkets! Clear out her den to reclaim them.
Smite the Ghoul Mother to recover %d of your lost trinkets.

There is a terrifying entity down in the sands. Since it began pulsing its beacon, the sun has gone dark over the valley. Whatever is causing this, it must be stopped by any means, before someone comes to meddle with powers beyond their grasp.
{?hero_names}%s were repelled from the ecliptic beacon.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The daylight is aberrant and unnerving, and has unique properties.
A murder has taken place aboard the ship and the killer is yet to be identified. Investigate the crew aboard the ship to determine the culprit.
The Otekh absconded from the ship after defeating {?hero_names}%s.
{?hero_names}%s revealed the Otekh before it could do any further damage.
{?hero_names}%s conducted an investigation aboard the airship.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} One of the crew is not who they claim to be...

When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they can become {colour_start|harmful}AFFLICTED{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} on the Flameseeker, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

Your hero has a {colour_start|symptom}symptom{colour_end}!
{colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end} begin with {colour_start|symptom}Symptoms{colour_end} which are more gentle than the fully contracted {colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end}. Disease kit provision items can be used to remove the symptoms, or lessen the effects of evolved diseases. Barring few exceptions, diseases can only be removed in the {colour_start|notable}Clinic{colour_end}.

Your hero is {colour_start|expiated}Expiated{colour_end}!
New statuses are applied in combat from both friends and foes, such as {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end}, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end}, and {colour_start|enraged}Enraged{colour_end}. {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end} debuffs target's damage received or dealt based on their last action, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end} damages the target on their next three attacks while healing the opposing party on the first one, and {colour_start|enraged}Enrage{colour_end} provides target with health and buffs upon killing their enemies. There are more statuses like that, which are applied by some specific enemy factions. Hover over the status icon on an affected target for more information.

Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}.
During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food!
{colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Respite Points{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation.
Additionally, when camping under the {colour_start|sun_torch}sun{colour_end} of Exposed Interior, ambush prevention is not necessary.

Quest durations have been adjusted to be slightly longer, and now all missions include 1 more {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end} than before. Be sure to supply yourself in anticipation of more fights, blockages, and hunger.
Short quests are strongly recommended for less experienced or prepared heroes.

Enemies and allies alike take advantage of a moment to brace themselves during the first round of combat. {colour_start|notable}Accuracy for ordinary attacks is halved and critical hits are impossible{colour_end}, some abilities however can ignore the Accuracy reduction of the {colour_start|notable}Prep Round{colour_end} and can be used for an initiating strike.
Additionally, {colour_start|notable}certain hero skills have their effects altered during the Prep Round{colour_end}, so be sure to read over your heroes' skill descriptions.

The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}.
The choice is yours.
Discretion is the better part of valor...
A rarer iteration of Room Curios, Vendors accept only a specific type of item and offer up valuables in exchange.

In Black Reliquary, inventory has seen some changes to better integrate with the changes made to other systems.
On top of two additional inventory slots, some items such as food, gold and gems had their stack size increased. Additionally, gems themselves are worth more than before.
As for the loot changes, the Relics (previously heirlooms) are now obtained in much higher numbers in their specific dungeons, so make sure to pick your missions wisely.

When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}. Heroes start with the maximum amount of {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} Resist.
While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}. Successive attacks received on and attacks that bring heroes to {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end} lower their {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} slightly for an extensive duration.
{colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}.
Some heroes are better than others at disarming, and Archaeology Kits can provide increased trap disarm chance when used.

Facilities in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} generate resources while you are on a quest! Remember to put heroes to work weekly to keep up your resource gain.
From there, clicking on the {colour_start|notable}[EMBARK]{colour_end} button at the bottom of the screen!

Hero panels now contain information about a class's various details which would be otherwise hidden in the {colour_start|notable}Hero Info{colour_end}. This shows information such as virtue chance, crit effects, riposte information, and more should that class have any other unique properties.

{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}.
If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to the Flameseeker before this happens.
Death awaits us all.

The display for the enemies' skills has been updated, and now in addition to showing more of the skills' effects, it also includes information about where and on what targets the skills can used on.
In Info Comms, accessible via either the {colour_start|notable}[G]{colour_end} hotkey or the main menu, you can see the explanations on meaning for each of the icons.
Just like before, a skill needs to be seen to show up on that panel.

Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents.
Additionally, the {colour_start|notable}Honing Oil{colour_end} supply is a good supplement to deal with those enemies for heroes that lack any other options.

{colour_start|notable}Positive quirks{colour_end} are now locked in by default, and will not be replaced.
The {colour_start|notable}Clinic{colour_end} can be used to remove undesirable positive quirks for a small fee.

Some quirks develop as a result of ongoing combat against factional enemies. This can result in both {colour_start|notable}positive{colour_end} and {colour_start|harmful}negative{colour_end} quirks based on the specific factions that are fought.
Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

Most abilities on heroes have seen some adjustments made to their stats and designs. Some of these changes are minute, and some are significant. Several abilities have also been replaced entirely.
Area of Effect abilities now have a {colour_start|notable}Negative Crit Multiplier{colour_end}: 2 Target AoEs: -40% CRT 3 Target AoEs: -60% CRT 4 Target AoEs: -70% CRT

Your heroes all carry different beliefs in their hearts. Some are devout to the {colour_start|affiliation_religious}Light{colour_end}, some worship the {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}pagan{colour_end} deities, and some {colour_start|affiliation_faithless}reject the gods entirely{colour_end}. Each type of affiliation has different advantages and disadvantages in combat, and while some heroes cannot fall into certain faiths, they can only be one of the three.

Some of the items you find will have special "Oddity" frame. This means that the item can be carried back to Flameseeker and used during one of your future expeditions, if you wish for item to be used on a different hero.

Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Clinic.

If you find yourself uncertain on aspects of Black Reliquary, try using the Help Menu (using {colour_start|notable}[H]{colour_end} as a hotkey).
There are multiple Help Menus available in different places; The Flameseeker, each airship facility, the provision menu, dungeon rooms, dungeon hallways, and in the middle of combat.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to the Flameseeker{colour_end} at any time - just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

Heroes who have returned from a successful quest in the Darkest Dungeon have seen too much. Depending on which game mode and game options you have selected, they may choose to never go back, or simply will be stressed upon re-entry.

Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works!
However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}.
{colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} gain and requirements have been adjusted to smooth out the progression curve for the course of Black Reliquary's campaign.

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Perfumer's Outpost{colour_end}! Advance to the marked tile, and press 'W' or click to enter.
The mysterious Perfumer conducts his clandestine experiments in numerous locations around the valley. He is known to offer up strange and intriguing objects, asking people to return to him after observing their power.
You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.

The ferry {colour_start|notable}allows you to recruit new heroes{colour_end}.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's icon to view their information.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Drag and drop]{colour_end} them into your roster.
The Ferry is Your Hero Lifeblood

While you're here, spend some of your starting relics on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Ferry's Sails and Cabins{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future. To upgrade click the {colour_start|notable}[+]{colour_end} symbol on the left, and then click the upgrade.

Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

There are many ways for heroes to spend their time on the Flameseeker.
Heroes can relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Galley{colour_end}.
Or they can produce and interact with {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end}.
Both the {colour_start|notable}Amber Refinery{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Tek Exchange{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} heal a very small amount of stress and {colour_start|notable}do not remove afflictions{colour_end}.
Committing a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level affects which enemies you may run into{colour_end}. The darker it gets, the more likely it is to run into challenging enemies which offer up greater rewards for defeating. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a torch from inventory to boost the light back up.
Likewise, certain enemies will also only appear in bright light, although they do not give more loot.

Each hero has room to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just {colour_start|notable}drag the trinket{colour_end} from inventory over to the {colour_start|notable}selected hero's slot{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}VIRTUOUS{colour_end}!
This elevated state of performance will last until they suffer a large amount of stress or return to the Flameseeker, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

The Perfumer asks that you {colour_start|notable}bring his trinkets back to him{colour_end} at a later time so that he may gather more materials and apply experimental enhancements to them. Please note that this interaction only works if the trinket is dragged from the player's provision inventory. If the trinket is equipped, you must put it there before interacting.
(Trinket interactions may appear invalid, but they still function as normal)

{colour_start|cursed_gem}Malignant Vestiges{colour_end} are a unique type of loot dropped mostly from Cactonid enemies. These exceedingly valuable treasures bring various penalties while in your inventory, so consider the effects carefully!
These effects do not stack. Each vestige downside is only applied once while in your inventory.
Cactonid fights are guaranteed to drop at least one vestige, and the {colour_start|cursed_gem}"Maligned"{colour_end} cactonids, summoned by performing an alum ritual near a cactonid, grant even more of them.

Yngolian drops {colour_start|yngolian1}Celestial{colour_end} trinkets. These special trinkets can be used in place of a standard torch to activate the Yngolian's Beacon, and in doing so will upgrade the trinket! [Remember that evolving trinkets must be placed in the inventory before they can be used on curios.]

Deception is everywhere!
Cactonids lie in wait to attack unsuspecting adventurers! {colour_start|notable}Most curios in the Treasury are disguised Cactonids ready to strike, but these creatures are overloaded with riches, both exotic and mundane.{colour_end} Certain interactions can be used to give yourself an advantage in fights against these floral beasts, so prepare accordingly.
While there are some roaming creatures which call the Treasury their home, most fights will be ones you initiate.
{colour_start|notable}Choose your fights carefully to bring home as many spoils as you can!{colour_end}
Listen up. This may save your skin.
Short for "accuracy". Base chance to hit is ACC minus the enemy's DODGE.
A log of major events that occur on the ship each week. Can be accessed while in the Flameseeker.

A temporary condition that may be triggered when a hero reaches 100 stress. Afflicted heroes act on their own and suffer stat penalties. Afflictions can be cured on the Ship by reducing the hero's stress at the Amber Den or the Galley.
A type of provision used to remove Blight. Antivenom ignores Blight Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
A hero's armor determines their base DODGE and MAX HP. Armor can be upgraded at the Forge.
A type of provision used to remove Bleed. Bandages ignores Bleed Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
Heroes or enemies with Bleed take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with items, combat skills, and Camping skills.
Heroes or enemies with Blight take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with items, combat skills, and Camping skills.
A relic typically found in the Catacombs. Used to upgrade buildings on the ship.
An ability used by a hero during Camping.
An ability used by a hero during combat.

Most dead monsters leave a temporary corpse. Corpses preserve the enemy order for a time and require heroes to use skills to attack around the corpses, move other enemies in reach, and so on. Alternatively, corpses can be attacked and cleared manually.
A relic found in Exposed Interior dungeons. Used to upgrade buildings in on the ship.

Short for "critical hit chance". Critical hits do extra damage and provide stress relief (when a hero crits) or stress damage (when a monster crits). Additionally, upon scoring critical hit, heroes gain a "Crit Effect" which can be found in their additional info.
A hit taken by a hero on Death's Door that permanently kills the hero.

Also known as "Mortality". A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door. Each subsequent instance of damage taken while at Death's Door has a chance of permanently killing the hero. Additionally, each hit taken while on Death's Door will lower the hero's Deathblow Resist for 32 tns
Bonus towards resisting incoming debuffs and marks.
A relic typically found in the Caverns. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship, as well as to produce Refined Amber Dust inside Amber Workshop.
A temporary sickness that debilitates the hero in some way. Disease Kits can tend the disease, but a fully evolved disease itself can only be cured in the Clinic.
Short for "damage". Determines how many health points, or HP, are removed from the target if an attack connects.
Dodge gets removed from the enemy's Accuracy to determine base chance to hit.
Commonly refers to the weapon and armor equipped to a hero, but can also include Trinkets. Weapons and armor cannot be unequipped but can be upgraded.
A type of provision used for Camping meals and other meals while wandering. Can be fed individually to a hero for a small HP recovery.
The basic currency of the Flameseeker. Used to purchase Trinkets, learn and upgrade skills, and upgrade Equipment.
A heart attack occurs when a hero reaches 200 stress while afflicted. This will drop a hero to Death's Door, or kill one already there.
A special currency type that is most often used to upgrade buildings on the Ship. There are four types of Relics: Matakh, Amber, Salvaged Jewelry, and Valor Marks.
A type of provision used to temporarily increase a hero's resistances. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
Short for "health points". HP is removed as damage is taken. A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door.
A type of provision used to cure a hero's combat debuffs. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
An effect that moves the target forward or backward in the party lineup.
Bonus towards resisting enemy moves that cause a position change.

An object found in dungeons that impedes the party's progress. They can be removed by hand or with an item (usually Shovel). Clearing an obstacle by hand inflicts DMG and negative effects on the entire party.
A Relic typically found in the Treasury. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship.
Short for "protection". Indicates what percentage of incoming damage is mitigated. DoTs (bleed, blight), effects and Expiated ignore PROT.
An item that can be added to the player's inventory before embarking on a quest, or found during it.

A character trait on a hero. Quirks can be beneficial (positive) or hindering (negative). Heroes may start with some quirks but acquire more through adventuring. Specific actions, such as attacking enemies or party members dying to enemies, have a chance to grant the hero specific quirks.
A stat that influences how likely a hero is to resist a particular status, such as Stun or Bleed.

The veteran level of a hero. A hero with higher Resolve Level can better resist stress, learn higher level skills and wield higher level equipment. Higher Resolve Level heroes will not waste their time on lower level quests. Low Resolve Level heroes adventuring in higher level dungeons will find it more stressful.
Earning Resolve XP progresses a hero towards the next Resolve Level. Resolve XP can only be earned by completing quests. Heroes do not earn Resolve XP if they abandon or fail quests.
The collection of all the player's hired heroes.
A type of provision. Used to clear obstacles to prevent taking DMG and stress. Can be used in curio interactions.
A type of provision used on curios in dungeons.
Short for "speed". Speed influences the order in which combatants act. Initiative is re-rolled each round per combatant. Base value is 1-12, plus modifiers.

Accrues as heroes travel through dungeons and engage in combat. When a hero reaches 100 stress, they acquire either an Affliction or a Virtue. At 200 stress, the hero suffers a heart attack if afflicted, or lose their Virtue if virtued.
An effect that forces the hero or enemy to pass on their next turn. Some stuns can last for an extended duration of time.
A type of provision. Used to increase the current torchlight within a dungeon.

The amount of light in a dungeon. Adventuring in brightness is safer but less rewarding, while adventuring in darkness is more dangerous but more rewarding. Can be increased by using torches and some combat skills.
A bonus towards avoiding or disarming traps.
A temporary condition of increased effectiveness that a hero acquires after passing an Affliction Check. Virtued heroes have buffs and may buff or otherwise increase the power of their allies.
A type of equipment used by a hero to combat the dangers found in dungeons. A hero's weapon determines their base DMG, CRT and SPD. Weapons can be upgraded at the Forge.
Made whenever a hero reaches 100 Stress and results in an Affliction or Virtue state.
Surprised heroes have their order jumbled. Heroes are surprised when Ambushed or randomly at the start of non-scouted enemy combats.
A hidden log of which Afflictions a particular hero has a tendency to develop.
An interactive prop found in a dungeon hallway or room.
Limited number of times that a skill may be used in each combat.

Monsters with Stealth cannot be hit with direct attacks until Stealth expires or is negated with a hero skill. AOE attacks CAN hit stealthed monsters, though, as long as there is any not-stealthed target to target!
Armor Piercing effects make attacks ignore part of target's PROT, which means the attack damage doesn't get reduced by protection as much.

Bubblenator is not a word in a dictionary. We just want to check how many people actually read those entries. You can redeem your award by going into trinket menu, pressing enter and typing "Reading Comprehension"
An indication of a disease that hero will get, if the symptom isn't tended to using Disease Kit nor cured in Clinic.
A tincture useful in the treatment of Horror (stress DOT). Also has interactions with some dungeon curios
Ship upgrades available for the Flameseeker
Mechanical devices primarily used to construct Side Decks.
An expensive type of provision used to remove Symptoms and tend to the Diseases, lessening their effects.
Stat bonus received if both trinkets of that set are equipped at the same time.
An expensive type of provision used to disarm traps more easily. Used heavily in curio interactions.
A type of provision used to deal with high PROT enemies more efficiently. Can be used in curio interactions.
Describes Hero's religiousness. This can affect results of certain combat skills, camping skills, and more.
First round of the combat, during which attacks can't crit and have lowered accuracy. Some attacks ignore the accuracy penalty, and can have changed effects during it.

Heroes or enemies with Mark will take additional damage and effects from certain skills. For enemies, Marks will additionally make them target Marked hero more often. It will eventually go away after specific number of rounds, but can be removed early with Ginseng Powder.
A buff hero or enemy get after recovering from stun, which will grant them more resilience against further Stuns, consisting of both short-duration buffs and a smaller, combat-long one.

An effect that heals the opposing team of the expiated unit upon its next attack. The affected unit also takes damage after their next three attacks. Unholy enemies take 50% more damage, Pagan heroes take 50% more damage, Religious heroes receive 100% healing upon activation. Each activation of Expiation's healing reduces its effectiveness for the battle. This effect cannot stack.
An effect that heals and temporarily boosts target's DMG and CRT on kill. Lasts till the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.

An effect that debuffs target's DMG when they attack or Damage Received each time they use a friendly skill. Debuffs last for a single turn, while the status itself lasts until the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.

Conscripted by the Vizier, the Levantine forces are tasked with the excavation and recovery of Kvarotz relics and technology. They operate as trained soldiers, typically working together and fighting with advanced tactics.
A collective of zealous crusaders that have come to plunder the valley. They battle with the power of the Light, and are typically more effective against Pagan heroes.
Remnants of the vast Kvarotz Empire. Their sentinels and enforcers still roam the Valley in the dark, and are extremely dangerous to the bodies and minds of those caught in their wake.
A matriarchal clan of nomadic warriors who worship Pagan gods and the pursuit of unmatched power. They fight with the utmost brutality and relentless onslaughts.
An effect that applies Shuffle over specific amount of turns.
Number of rounds before a skill can be used again. Cooldowns are refreshed on combat end.

A refined version of Amber. Can be created in the Amber Refinery Activity in the Amber Workshop Facility on the Flameseeker, and occasionally found as loot. Used to purchase luxury provisions, use the Amber Den Activity, and to buy Contraband Trinkets.

The devolved creatures deep within the caverns, these insectoid savages practice sinister rituals and feast upon raw amber far below the surface. They wear down their opponents with overwhelming numbers rather than individual strength. Due to the their blindness they also completely ignore Stealth.

These eldritch hybrids of flesh and flora have overgrown the Kvarotz treasury. They lie in wait, ready to spring upon victims who unwittingly spring their traps, bombarding their prey with various statuses.
Highly valuable treasures which apply debuffs to heroes while in the inventory. These debuffs do not stack with multiple of the same vestige. Mostly dropped by Cactonids in the Treasury.

Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Debilitating Daylight" torch effects, and are always set to 100 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: -8 DODGE, -4 SPD, Can't be Ambushed Monster Effects: -4 DODGE Torch Effects: Buff Hero Party: +5 ACC (1 Battle){colour_end}

Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Mantling Moonlight" torch effects, and are always set to 0 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: +3% CRT, +15% Stress Received Monster Effects: +5% CRT, Certain Enemies start battle with Stealth Torch Effects: Buff Hero: Ignore Stealth (1 tn){colour_end}
A consumable item which applies Damage Buff and Damage Received debuff to the hero. Buffs are halved for Religious and doubled for Pagan. Repeated use gives diminishing returns.
An item which grants 1 Block to its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
An item which grants temporary riposte to its user. Produced by the Adrenaline Manufactorum, and obtained from the provision screen.
An item which cures almost all statuses on its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
When a Frantic hero performs a non-fatal attack, they have a chance to be moved backwards and become horrified.
When a Leeched hero performs a friendly skill, they blight themselves and apply restoration to the enemy party.
An effect that restores health at the beginning of a hero's turn.

Items obtained using Perfumer's Needle, which can be used to debuff the enemy party. Type of Extract found depends on the Region you're in: Catacombs - Decrepit Extract - Debuffs PROT and Crit Received Exposed Interior - Rabid Extract - Debuffs ACC and CRT Caverns - Ancient Extract - Debuffs status chance Treasury - Living Extract - Debuffs Healing Received and Blight Resistance
Symptom which can be contracted via the Ghoulserum Injection. If not treated, evolves into Ghoul Plague. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.
Disease which evolves from Ghoul Fever. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, it also increases likelyhood of party encountering Ghouls. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.

Symptom which can be contracted via the Parasite Zero. If not treated, evolves into Rictus Mortis. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, this disease buffs the hero's SPD and CRT when Hexer consumes his Vials of Corruption. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.

Diseases evoled from Rictus Imperfectus. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, this disease buffs the hero's SPD and CRT when Hexer consumes his Vials of Corruption. This effect is removed if the disease is treated. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.
Bounties can be obtained using "Big Prize" Contraband trinket, stack up to 99 per inventory slot, and they grant 200 gold each.

Special Exposed Interior quest which subject heroes and enemies to the "Encroaching Eclipse" torch effects, and are always set to 0 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: -20% Bleed Resist, -14% Deathblow Resist Monster Effects: +15% Bleed Resist Torch Effects: Target: Cure Bleed, +4 Stress{colour_end}
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Aspects of the Flameseeker are subject to change as Black Reliquary develops.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Not all mechanics and functions in Black Reliquary are finalized.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Remember to place heroes in the Amber Refinery each week.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Positive quirks are now locked in by default, and can be removed in the Clinic.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Positive quirks can no longer be replaced by new quirks. Money will need to be spent to make space for new quirks.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Disease kits can remove symptoms and mitigate diseases.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The filthy Troglodytes are resistant to toxins and cuts, but their carapaced bodies are easily stunned.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Put down the swarming Troglodytes quickly. There is strength in numbers.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The mollusk-like Trogs are covered in vile secretions that can cause disease. Prepare accordingly.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Alum will be useful to ward against the dark powers channeled by the Troglodytes.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Shovels have a wide variety of uses in these carved-out and rubble-filled caverns.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Disease kits will be helpful against the sludge and decay-riddled objects within the caverns.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Allowing to safely collect amber, bandages will find a lot of use in those caves.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Camping buffs are a powerful tool! Don't save your campfires for when it's already too late.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Caverns hold the most Amber of any region.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most curios can be approached in multiple ways to ensure different positive results.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Frequently checking buffs and debuffs on allies and enemies can keep control over the battlefield.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Deception is all around you. Choose your interactions carefully.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Curios in the Treasury can have unusual effects with certain items.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Many Cactonids are ready to counter-attack. Be sure to plan your actions.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Treasury has few normal encounters.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Cactonids can have high resistances; choose your party accordingly.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most fights in the Treasury are triggered manually.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Cactonids contain great amounts of plunder, but you will need to fight your way to it.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Greed comes naturally to most. Try to keep it in check.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Use your campfires! Do not take the benefits of camping skills for granted.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Treasury holds the most Salvaged Jewelry of any region.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Cactonids sometimes ingest rare and unique loot. Alum rituals can awaken these treasures, maligning the host.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most curios can be approached in multiple ways to ensure different positive results.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Frequently checking buffs and debuffs on allies and enemies can keep control over the battlefield.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The ancient Kvarotz mechanisms still skulk in the shadows.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Levantine have come to pilfer the vast necropolis of the Kvarotz.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Levantine soldiers are organized and disciplined, taking advantage of tactical opportunities.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Treasure is not found in darkness, but rather because of it.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Rusted Kvarotz electrum can be revitalized when oiled.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The sinister technology and knowledge of the Kvarotz contain dangerous powers.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Levantine take advantage of the chance to brace for combat, as should you.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Vendors ask for specific relics or special items to exchange.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most curios have multiple ways to approach them. Experimentation is the key!
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Catacombs hold the most Matakh of any region.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most curios can be approached in multiple ways to ensure different positive results.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Frequently checking buffs and debuffs on allies and enemies can keep control over the battlefield.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Wildlanders are unrelenting in combat. Do not expect opportunities to present themselves.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The oppressive heat of the sun will bear down on your heroes during the {colour_start|sun_torch}Day{colour_end}.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The shroud of {colour_start|moon_torch}Night{colour_end} can grant particular advantages to your foes.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Some enemies will behave differently depending upon the time of day.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Certain enemies will appear more often during certain times of the day.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Lifetimes of violence have thickened the Wildlanders' skin and made them resilient to bleeding.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Relying on a single healer can get messy. A second pair of helping hands can make all the difference.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The Exposed Interior holds the most Valor Marks of any region.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Most curios can be approached in multiple ways to ensure different positive results.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Frequently checking buffs and debuffs on allies and enemies can keep control over the battlefield.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} During the {colour_start|moon_torch}Night{colour_end}, torches can provide temporary {colour_start|stealth}Stealth{colour_end} bypass.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}{?dungeon_name}%s:{colour_end} The Exposed Interior has been unlocked.
The currency of the Kvarotz society, comprised of electrum.
Wildlander tokens denoting one's strength and accomplishments.
A mystical substance flowing from the Reliquary into the valley.
There is something odd about this beautiful jewelry...
Carefully extracted and ground into a fine powder, this refined luxury is worth its weight in gold...
Valor Mark: %d (Used to upgrade airship facilities.)
Salvaged Jewelry: %d (Used to upgrade airship facilities.)
Refined Amber Dust: %d (Used for luxury resources and activities.)
Lost Tek: %d (Used to create ship decks.)
[OPTIONAL] Drag an item here to use it on this object.
[This is quest curio. No item is necessary to open it.]
Leftover pottery from the Kvarotz dynasty.
Treasure is among the shattered ceramic!
The vase is encrusted with riches!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
There could be something useful here...
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
There could be something useful here...
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
A stone slab containing dark Kvarotz knowledge.
The hero gains great insight into these lands!
The ancient tablet lashes out at its attacker.
The tablet reveals the secrets of these lands!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
Leftover pottery from a Kvarotz dynasty.
Treasure is among the shattered ceramic!
The vase is encrusted with riches!
The vase has Daric embedded onto its base!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
A stone slab containing dark Kvarotz knowledge.
The hero gains great insight into these lands!
The ancient tablet lashes out at its attacker.
The tablet reveals the secrets of these lands!
A hidden chamber on the tablet's back side is revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
There is dark power in the altar!
Destroying the wicked altar gives peace of mind.
The cleansed altar brings a sense of wellness.
The compendium reveals riches in the centerpiece!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
Wicked weapons of a forgotten era.
Some of these weapons are decorative!
These weapons and tools can garner much knowledge of the Kvarotz.
The hero cuts their hand on a rusted weapon.
Once sharpened, this weapon is rather nice!
One of these dusty objects is a trinket!
Kvarotz weapons don't make for good cutlery.
A hidden chamber inside is revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
A dust-coated Kvarotz weapon of war.
The cannon is barren and of no importance.
You collect some of the Kvarotz gunpowder for your own use.
The hero cuts their hand on the rusted electrum.
The electrum metal in the cannon reacts strangely...
The opulent cannon is covered in gold and jewels!
The cannon fire draws the Levantine to your position!
A secret compartment inside the barrel is revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
This one was laid to rest with riches!
Unspeakable things must have been done to this person...
The salt is corrupted and erupts into black smoke.
The gemstones on it are pried off...
This tomb is majestic and encrusted with jewels!
The protective alum allows for an investigation.
A hidden cache in the sarcophagus is revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
An ornate coffin for a member of the Kvarotz upper class.
Surely nothing bad can come of graverobbing...
This occupant seems to have been mummified alive!
Noxious fumes of rotted flesh pour out.
The coffin is pried open from a safe distance.
The bandage guards against torture devices inside the coffin!
A small box in the mummy's chest is revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
There could be something useful here...
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
Charts and correspondance left behind by the Levantine.
The charts and maps here prove most helpful!
The enemy's maps are burnt to a crisp!
Upon closer inspection, secrets of the Catacombs are revealed!
The key unlocks a celestial vault.
